title: Cisplatin-Associated Acute Kidney Injury (CP-AKI) Risk Calculator
description: Predicts the risk of acute kidney injury in patients treated with intravenous cisplatin. This calculator estimates the probability of moderate to severe AKI (≥2-fold rise in serum creatinine or need for kidney replacement therapy within 14 days of cisplatin administration).

result.name: cp_aki_risk
result.description: Estimated risk of moderate to severe acute kidney injury

ranges.interpretation: Low risk of cisplatin-associated acute kidney injury (< 5%). Standard monitoring may be appropriate. Consider baseline and follow-up creatinine measurements.
Moderate risk of cisplatin-associated acute kidney injury (5-15%). Enhanced monitoring recommended. Consider prophylactic measures such as aggressive hydration and electrolyte repletion.
High risk of cisplatin-associated acute kidney injury (15-30%). Close monitoring essential. Consider dose modification, alternative chemotherapy regimens, or nephrology consultation.

Very high risk of cisplatin-associated acute kidney injury (≥30%). Strong consideration should be given to alternative treatment options. If cisplatin is necessary, intensive monitoring and prophylactic measures are mandatory. Nephrology consultation strongly recommended.

references: Gupta S, Portales-Castillo I, Daher A, Kitchlu A. Derivation and external validation of a simple risk score for predicting severe acute kidney injury after intravenous cisplatin: cohort study. BMJ. 2024 Mar 27;384:e077169. doi: 10.1136/bmj-2023-077169.

Motwani SS, McMahon GM, Humphreys BD, Partridge AH, Waikar SS, Curhan GC. Development and Validation of a Risk Prediction Model for Acute Kidney Injury After the First Course of Cisplatin. J Clin Oncol. 2018 Mar 1;36(7):682-688. doi: 10.1200/JCO.2017.75.7161.
formula: Risk (%) = 1 / (1 + e^(-X)) × 100, where X is calculated using patient characteristics including age, comorbidities, and laboratory values
notes: This calculator predicts moderate to severe AKI, defined as ≥2-fold rise in serum creatinine or need for kidney replacement therapy within 14 days
Derived from a cohort of 24,717 patients across 6 US academic cancer centers (2006-2022)
Model achieved c-statistic of 0.75, outperforming previous risk models
Consider alternative chemotherapy regimens in high-risk patients
